technology.name: Plight of the No-Horns
technology.description: The Beastmen have been traversing the deep forests for countless generations. And so the beast-paths have formed, deep ruts hidden in the undergrowth that even the huntsmen of the Empire would struggle to discover. Some beast-paths fall out of use, lost for generations, only to be discovered again by Ungor trackers many years later. These ancient ways are seen as a boon by the Bray-Shamans, their use encouraged to prevent such routes falling into ignorance once again.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Ungor Herd and Ungor Spearmen Herd units
Leadership: +4 for Ungor Herd and Ungor Spearmen Herd units

technology.name: Raining Blood
technology.description: Few Beastmen possess the skill or patience for ranged combat, but still value the bow as a tool of the hunt.

effects.description: Ammunition: +15% for Ungor Raiders units
Reload time reduction: +10% for Ungor Raiders units

technology.name: The Unnatural Order
technology.description: It is always a bit of mystery from where some Beastmen, most notably, Centigors, get their grog or acidic wine. Mostly, it is stolen from more advanced races, but there are rumours of herds stumbling across fermenting fruit and honey and even given rudimentary instructions on how to turn such bounty into liquor by the Bray-Shamans. In any case, Beastmen are full of rage and violence.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +10% for Gor Herd and Centigors units

technology.name: Savage Mantle
technology.description: With thick hide and great horns, each Beastman is a heavily-muscled brute of preternatural toughness.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Gor Herd and Bestigor Herd units

technology.name: Empire of Beasts
technology.description: If the Beastlord follows the tenets of Slaa - as the Dark Prince is oft-known among the Beastmen - then he will allow his Gors to rut and mewl and wallow in their own fifth, as well as bathe in and consume enemy blood. This leads many Beastmen into a state of euphoria; to become 'gore-drunk'. A generous Beastlord who grants his Gors such a boon will gather many followers.

effects.description: Enemy siege holdout time: -3 (minimum 1 turn)

Missile resistance: 10% during siege battles
	(all armies)

technology.name: Bestial Resilience
technology.description: Large blades, scavenged from battlefields or stolen from the armouries of man, Dwarf and even Orc, are ideal for larger Gors and Minotaurs. These weapons are prized by the bulkier Beastmen, as a strike from one endowed with bestial muscles is often enough to slice right through the waist of an armoured man.

effects.description: Physical resistance: 10% for Chaos Warhounds, Harpies, Razorgor Herd and Manticore units.

technology.name: Days of Wrath
technology.description: The Chaos Gods always have need of willing agents - mortal, horned or otherwise. Should these agents prove useful, then they will be rewarded by the granting of boons and favour. However, to be under the scrutiny of such Dark Powers is often a double-edged blade, for the Gods do not tolerate failure.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Minotaur units

technology.name: Rampage!
technology.description: Beastmen are creatures of atavistic fury, and it takes little to drive them into a frenzy of unbridled aggression.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +8% for Minotaur, Cygors, Giants and Ghorgons.

technology.name: Worldbane
technology.description: Beastmen are oft creatures of habit, ranging territory familiar to them. However, when the opportunity to hunt fresh blood-grounds comes (perhaps the Bray-Shamans have negotiated with rival tribes or a previous threat has been neutralised) then the Gors will rejoice, for there is no greater joy than hunting in strange lands with fresh scents, new lairs, and greater prey!

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +8% when fighting against Dwarfs, High Elves, Wood Elves, Dark Elves and Men
	(all armies)

technology.name: Death from the Shadows
technology.description: While the Dark Gods may favour those mortals who willingly give their souls to Chaos, Beastmen are the true Children of Chaos. They are born or created to be part of Chaos, intrinsically so, rather than persuaded, tempted, or seduced. And so, when the gaze of the Ruinous Powers falls upon the Beastmen, it is as a parent looking upon their quarrelsome children.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +15%
	(all armies)

technology.name: Rolling Death
technology.description: Whether a true-born Gor, or one of the mongrel things that was once a man, a Beastman's heart is wholly owned by Chaos. Yet there are those beasts whose soul is blacker than most; they are the chieftains, Beastlords and other agents of the Dark Powers with the wherewithal or physical might to emerge dominant over the herds.

effects.description: Melee defence: +5 for Razorgor Chariots, Razorgor Herd and Tuskgor Chariots units.
Bonus vs Infantry: +5 for Razorgor Chariots, Razorgor Herd and Tuskgor Chariots units.

technology.name: The Rewards of Ruin
technology.description: In the north, the Everchosen makes his plans, but the Cloven Ones have much say in the Old World's fate also. Such dark times - such days of wrath - will be a chance for all Beastmen to be touched by Chaos - to feel the Dark Powers'  strength ooze into their twisted souls.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10% for Ghorgon and Giant units.

technology.name: Born to Lead
technology.description: Beastmen put great stock in their Herdstones, for they are physical monuments to their malefic, Chaotic masters. A Herdstone inscribed in runes from the Dark Tongue and washed in blood from a warherd's most hated of enemies will provide a greater bounty than lesser Herdstones.

effects.description:
Leadership aura size: +15%
	(all characters)

Character's aura leadership effect: +3
	(all characters)

technology.name: Vitriolic Temperament
technology.description: There is a reason that the darkest, most fell of rituals are rarely spoken. To utter such things is to risk more than your life - your very soul could be consumed by Daemons as a tasty morsel for the servants of the Chaos Gods if they believe the utterer not worthy enough. Yet a Bray-Shaman who speaks the dark tongue and pleases his masters may see his tribe greatly rewarded.

effects.description: Melee defence: +6 for Centigors units
Melee attack: +6 for Centigors units

technology.name: Man-Cleavers
technology.description: The more Gors and true-horns fight for their place by the side of the Beastlord, the larger the warherds become. The strongest and meanest of these recruits are selected for the Bestigor herds, but for Gors that don't make the cut there remains plenty of opportunity to sow destruction and then - maybe - impress their chieftain in the battles to come.

effects.description: Weapon Strength: +8% for Razorgor Herd units
Horde growth: +3
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +6 for Chaos Warhounds and Harpies units.

technology.name: Roaming Torment
technology.description: The Beastmen have always hunted the blood-grounds for quarry. Nowadays, things are no different, but should whispers of a brayherd spread then the herds will come in force and Gors from far-afield tribes join, for their is much glory in raiding and murdering in the name of the Dark Gods.

effects.description: Ammunition: +15% for Cygor Units
Reload time reduction: +15% for Cygor units

technology.name: On Cloven Hoof & Twisted Claw
technology.description: Beastmen prefer close combat. This comes from no place of honour, it is simply what bestial folk do best. Only for results do their raging Gods care, and if this can be achieved by slaying up close - or from a greater distance - then so be it!

effects.description: Speed: +5% for all units

technology.name: Smell Their Fear
technology.description: Beastmen are expert ambushers, using the undergrowth and the secret beast-paths to their advantage, encircling their foes before striking against the enemy from several different directions. The more experienced a warherd becomes the better they ambush, being able to surround their opponents with impressive speed.

effects.description:
Attribute: Causes Fear when ambushing
	(all armies)

technology.name: Gaze of the Dark Gods
technology.description: Gors will drape themselves in gory tokens and grisly trophies to mark their triumphs. Although the Beastmen have many foes, they take particular delight in despoiling the artefacts and corpses of mankind, for that is a literal sign of their ultimate goal: to end civilisation. To wear such vile icons about its disgusting person empowers the wearer and commands respect.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Regeneration" for Chaos Spawn and Jabberslythe units.

technology.name: The Kalkengard Larder
technology.description: Ragush of the Bloody Horn was a monstrous Doombull that put the poor town of Kalkengard to the torch. Its defenders were rounded up and the choicest mortals eaten, but those left alive after the Minotaurs and Gors had feasted faced a far more horrible fate. They were hung from the burnt ruins, rocky spires, and trees in the area. Whenever the herds of Ragush hungered, they would return to the larder to feed. It is a brutish concept that other warherds have doubtless copied.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +10 for Minotaur units
Attribute: Vanguard Deployment for Minotaur units.

technology.name: Horns of War
technology.description: It is on the path to war that the brayherds must travel. If a Beastlord is to rise in power and stature, then he must make battle with man and fellow Gor, Greenskin and rat-filth, beardling and fey tree-clinger alike. All must fall before the blades and horns of Chaos' Children - all must die by the Beastmen's bray!

effects.description: Army capacity: +1
Passive ability: "Guardian" for Lords and embedded Heroes

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

technology.name: The Strong Survive
technology.description: The rewards of Ruin are hate, rage, fury, and a vile vigour that keeps the Gors fighting fit; it is said to be a "dark blessing". The Chaos Gods demand their servants be of rude health, so that they may despoil and destroy in their twisted, Ruinous name.

effects.description: Army capacity: +1
Dread gained from battles: +25%

technology.name: Messenger of the Bray
technology.description: An agent of the Chaos Gods, acting in their stead, will be granted favour… until they fail.

effects.description: Hero action cost: -50%

Campaign line of sight: +15%
	(all characters)
Enemy Hero action success chance: -10%

technology.name: Primal Fury
technology.description: The Bray-Shamans claim that only true-horns can tame a Razorgor - the fierce porcine beasts of rage and burden - for they share a common link. Both are savage and when their eyes meet there is a common bond and hatred of everything that is not of the wild.

effects.description: Army capacity: +1
Passive ability: "Primal Fury Upgraded"

technology.name: The Warherd Ravages
technology.description: Although Bray-Shamans receive more disturbing dreams and visions than other Gors, the Gods choose other conduits as needed to project their Ruinous will upon their minions. Such visions may be hard to interpret but other episodes are easier to understand and act upon.

effects.description:
Campaign movement range: +10%
	(all characters)
Horde growth: +2

technology.name: Kadon Unleashed
technology.description: All Beastmen are fell-tempered beasts, but some are quicker to rage than others; considered to be touched by the Granter of Savage Hate and known as 'Khorngors' by some. A wise Beastlord will bind such creatures together in herds and send them forth into the thick of the fighting.

effects.description: Spell number of uses: +2 for "Transformation of Kadon"

ui_effects.description: ➖ Spawned unit fights in this battle only
➖ Spawned unit fights in this battle only

effects.description: Spell number of uses: +1 for "Savage Dominion"

technology.name: Dominate the World
technology.description: The Cloven Ones cannot rest until all civilisation lies in ruin, and everything noble is trampled beneath their blood-encrusted hooves.

effects.description:
Miscast base chance: -25%
	(all characters)

Winds of Magic power reserve: +20
	(all armies)

technology.name: Consume Order
technology.description: Though they favour the flesh of men, the Beastmen are indiscriminate in their hatred of all civilised races.

effects.description:
Cooldown: -10% to Lores of Beasts, Wild, Shadows and Death spells
	(all characters)

Winds of Magic cost: -10% for Lores of Beasts, Wild, Shadows and Death spells
	(all characters)
